alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson and Orleans. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Recent radar trends indicate rain rates are diminishing, however ponding and minor flooding from earlier intense rainfall will still be possible in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Metairie, Jefferson and Bridge City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
